page.title: 07Housing Amberley/Rackham
page.content: Most of the houses in this area are lived in by their owners. The large farm houses have been occupied by the same family for several generations, but the farmers are tenant farmers to the Parham Estate. Kithurst farm was completely rebuilt using old stone in 1912. At each farm there are 2 to 6 tied cottages, some of which are occupied by farm workers and some of which are occupied by retired workers from the Parham Estate. The 3 houses in Storrington in the area are large well equipped houses with large gardens. Paygate cottage at Springhead has recently been enlarged and added to. Of the 24 Council houses in Amberley included in this area. known as Crossgated 12 are still owned by the Council.
